normalization

Class Algos

  • java.lang.Object
    • normalization.Algos

  • public class Algos
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a utility class to perform operations involving functional dependencies (FD's)
    Author:
    SUN XIMENG (Nathaniel)

    • Method Detail

      • check3NF

        public static java.util.Set<FuncDep> check3NF(java.util.Set<Attribute> attrs,
                                              java.util.Set<FuncDep> fds)
        Check if a relation is in the third normal form (3NF)
        Parameters:
        attrs - the set of attributes in a relation
        fds - the set of FD's on this relation
        Returns:
        true if this relation is in 3NF

      • checkBCNF

        public static java.util.Set<FuncDep> checkBCNF(java.util.Set<Attribute> attrs,
                                               java.util.Set<FuncDep> fds)
        Check if a relation is in Boyce-Codd normal form (BCNF)
        Parameters:
        attrs - the set of attributes in a relation
        fds - the set of FD's on this relation
        Returns:
        true if this relation is in BCNF

      • checkLossyDecomposition

        public static java.util.Set<FuncDep> checkLossyDecomposition(java.util.Set<Attribute> attrs,
                                                             java.util.Set<FuncDep> fds,
                                                             java.util.Set<java.util.Set<Attribute>> subattrs)
        Check if a certain decomposition of a relation will cause FD loss
        Parameters:
        attrs - attributes in the original relation
        fds - all the FD's in the original relation
        subattrs - each Set<Attribute> represents a decomposed relation from the original relation
        Returns:
        the set of FD's that will be lost if this decomposition is performed

      • closure

        public static java.util.Set<Attribute> closure(java.util.Set<Attribute> attrs,
                                               java.util.Set<FuncDep> fds)
        Compute the closure of a set of attributes under a set of FD's
        Parameters:
        attrs - a set of attributes
        fds - a set of FD's
        Returns:
        a set of attributes, i.e. the closure

      • combineRight

        public static void combineRight(java.util.Set<FuncDep> fds)
        In-place combine the right side of the FD's that have the same left side
        Parameters:
        fds - a set of FD's

      • equivalent

        public static boolean equivalent(java.util.Set<FuncDep> a,
                                 java.util.Set<FuncDep> b)
        Check if two sets of FD's are equivalent to each other (i.e. each can be deduced from another)
        Parameters:
        a - a set of FD's
        b - another set of FD's
        Returns:
        true if they are equivalent

      • keys

        public static java.util.Set<java.util.Set<Attribute>> keys(java.util.Set<Attribute> attrs,
                                                           java.util.Set<FuncDep> fds)
        Compute all the candidate keys
        Parameters:
        attrs - a set of attributes
        fds - a set of FD's
        Returns:
        a set of candidate keys, and each "key" is itself a set of attributes

      • minimalBasis

        public static java.util.Set<FuncDep> minimalBasis(java.util.Set<FuncDep> fds)
        Compute the minimal basis (aka. minimal cover). Notice this method only returns ONE of the possible solutions, depending on the order in which the attributes and FD's are stored in the memory.
        Parameters:
        fds - a set of FD's
        Returns:
        a set of FD's as the minimal basis

      • powerSet

        public static <T> java.util.Set<java.util.Set<T>> powerSet(java.util.Set<T> originalSet)
        Generate the power set, with the empty set.
        Parameters:
        originalSet - the original set
        Returns:
        the power set

      • projection

        public static java.util.Set<FuncDep> projection(java.util.Set<Attribute> attrs,
                                                java.util.Set<FuncDep> fds)
        Project a set of FD's on a subset of attributes
        Parameters:
        attrs - a set of attributes
        fds - a set of FD's
        Returns:
        a set of FD's as the projection

      • reducedPowerSet

        public static <T> java.util.Set<java.util.Set<T>> reducedPowerSet(java.util.Set<T> originalSet)
        Generate the power set (i.e. set of all the subsets) of a generic set, but without the empty set.
        Parameters:
        originalSet - the original set
        Returns:
        the reduced power set

      • removeTrivial

        public static void removeTrivial(java.util.Set<FuncDep> fds)
        Remove all trivial FD's from a set of FD's
        Parameters:
        fds - a set of FD's

      • removeUnnecessaryEntireFD

        public static int removeUnnecessaryEntireFD(java.util.Set<FuncDep> fds)
        In-place remove all the unnecessary FD's, and the result is still equivalent to the original set of FD's
        Parameters:
        fds - a set of FD's
        Returns:
        the total number of FD's removed

      • removeUnnecessaryLeftSide

        public static int removeUnnecessaryLeftSide(java.util.Set<FuncDep> fds)
        In-place remove all the unnecessary attributes on the left side of each FD, and the result is still equivalent to the original set of FD's
        Parameters:
        fds - a set of FD's
        Returns:
        the total number of attributes removed

      • splitRight

        public static void splitRight(java.util.Set<FuncDep> fds)
        In-place split the right side of each FD in this set
        Parameters:
        fds - a set of FD's

      • superKeys

        public static java.util.Set<java.util.Set<Attribute>> superKeys(java.util.Set<Attribute> attrs,
                                                                java.util.Set<FuncDep> fds)
        Compute all the superkeys (including candidate keys)
        Parameters:
        attrs - a set of attributes
        fds - a set of FD's
        Returns:
        a set of superkeys, and each "superkey" is itself a set of attributes
